passage.title: A barking dog
passage.paragraph: A father and his son go out for a walk. On their way, a dog is barking nearby.
The son cries, "Oh, help! A dog is over there."
The father says, "Don't be afraid, Tom. Don't you know the proverb 'A barking dog does not bit'?"
"Yes. I know it, and you know the proverb, but does the dog know the proverb?"
